/Users/trevorw/projects/tke-code/lib/bnotebook.tcl

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 # This code is a modified version based on the ButtonNotebook widget
00002 # available at:  http://paste.tclers.tk/895?v=raw
00003 #
00004 # Replace the standard notebook tab with one that includes a close
00005 # button.  To use, create a ttk::notebook widget and set the -style
00006 # option to BNotebook.
00007 #
00008 # In future versions of ttk this will be supported more directly when
00009 # the identify command will be able to identify parts of the tab.
00010 
00011 namespace eval BNotebook {
00012 
00013   # Tk 8.6 has the Visual Styles element engine on windows. If this is
00014   # available we use it to get proper windows close buttons.
00015   #
00016   proc CreateElements {} {
00017     if {[lsearch -exact [ttk::style element names] close] == -1} {
00018       if {[catch {
00019         # WINDOW WP_SMALLCLOSEBUTTON (19)
00020         # WINDOW WP_MDICLOSEBUTTON (20)
00021         # WINDOW WP_MDIRESTOREBUTTON (22)
00022         ttk::style element create close vsapi \
00023           WINDOW 20 {disabled 4 {active pressed} 3 active 2 {} 1}
00024       }]} then {
00025         CreateImageElements
00026       }
00027     }
00028   }
00029    
00030   proc CreateImageElements {} {
00031     # Create two image based elements to provide buttons to close the
00032     # tabs or to display an image which provides user-defined functionality.
00033     namespace eval ::img {}
00034     set imgdir [file join $::tke_dir lib images]
00035     image create bitmap ::img::blank       -file [file join $imgdir blank.bmp]
00036     image create bitmap ::img::close       -file [file join $imgdir close.bmp] -foreground grey50
00037     image create bitmap ::img::closeactive -file [file join $imgdir close.bmp] -foreground grey10
00038     if {[lsearch -exact [ttk::style element names] close] == -1} {
00039       if {[catch {
00040         ttk::style element create close image \
00041           [list ::img::blank \
00042             {active !pressed !disabled} ::img::close \
00043             {active pressed !disabled} ::img::closeactive] \
00044           -padding 8 -sticky {}
00045       } err]} { puts stderr $err }
00046     }
00047   }
00048    
00049   proc Init {{pertab 0}} {
00050     
00051     # Make sure that tab has the same padding as the clam theme
00052     ttk::style configure BNotebook.Tab -padding {6 2 0 2}
00053     
00054     ttk::style map BNotebook.Tab \
00055       -background [list !selected grey]
00056 
00057     CreateElements
00058     
00059     # This places the buttons on the right end of the tab area -- but in
00060     # Tk 8.5 we cannot identify these elements.
00061     if {!$pertab} {
00062       ttk::style layout BNotebook {
00063         BNotebook.client -sticky nswe
00064         BNotebook.close  -side right -sticky ne
00065       }
00066     }
00067     
00068     # This places the button elements on each tab which uses quite a
00069     # lot of space but we can identify the elements. Changes to the 
00070     # widget state affect all the button elements though.
00071     if {$pertab} {
00072       ttk::style layout BNotebook {
00073         BNotebook.client -sticky nswe
00074       }
00075       ttk::style layout BNotebook.Tab {
00076         BNotebook.tab -sticky nswe -children {
00077           BNotebook.padding -side top -sticky nswe -children {
00078             BNotebook.focus -side top -sticky nswe -children {
00079               BNotebook.label -side left -sticky {}
00080               BNotebook.close -side left -sticky {}
00081             }
00082           }
00083         }
00084       }
00085     }
00086     
00087     if {$::ttk::currentTheme eq "xpnative"} {
00088       ttk::style configure BNotebook.Tab -width -8
00089     }
00090     # bind TNotebook <ButtonPress-1> {+::BNotebook::Press %W %x %y}
00091     # bind TNotebook <ButtonRelease-1> {+::BNotebook::Release %W %x %y}
00092     bind TNotebook <Motion> {+::BNotebook::Motion %W %x %y}
00093     bind TNotebook <<ThemeChanged>> [namespace code [list Init $pertab]]
00094   }
00095    
00096   # Hook in some event extras:
00097   # set the state to pressed if button down over a button element.
00098   proc Motion {w x y} {
00099     set e [$w identify $x $y]
00100     if {[string match "*close" $e]} {
00101       $w state pressed
00102     } else {
00103       $w state !pressed
00104     }
00105     # puts "w: $w, state: [$w state]"
00106   }
00107    
00108   # Initialize the BNotebook namespace
00109   BNotebook::Init 1
00110 
00111 }
00112
